vision.notes: Likely important for hunting fish underwater and navigating coastal environments. Plumage coloration varies across species, suggesting a role in visual communication.

hearing.notes: Hearing is likely used for communication within nesting colonies and for detecting predators. Further data needed to detail frequency range and sensitivity.

mechanoreception.notes: Important for underwater navigation and prey detection via hydrodynamic cues; also for balance and spatial orientation in flight and on land.

taste/chemoreception.notes: Necessary for assessing food quality. Specific details on taste preferences or receptor types are unknown.

olfaction.notes: The role of olfaction in cormorants is not mentioned in the provided text, so it is unknown if they rely on it.
